 Restore a whole collection of items to the entity's inventory at once. We assume that the items already have all their fields correctly filled out. The items are not flagged for persistence to the database, since they are being restored from persistence rather than being newly added.

Detailed Description

Interface to an ISceneChildEntity's inventory.

This is not a finished 1.0 candidate interface

void Aurora.Framework.IEntityInventory.ForceInventoryPersistence (  ) 

Force the task inventory of this prim to persist at the next update sweep.

summary> Reset UUIDs for all the items in the prim's inventory. /summary> This involves either generating new ones or setting existing UUIDs to the correct parent UUIDs.

If this method is called and there are inventory items, then we regard the inventory as having changed. param name = "linkNum">Link number for the part

Implemented in OpenSim.Region.Framework.Scenes.SceneObjectPartInventory.

TaskInventoryItem Aurora.Framework.IEntityInventory.GetInventoryItem ( UUID  itemId  ) 

Returns an existing inventory item. Returns the original, so any changes will be live.

Returns:
null if the item does not exist

IList<TaskInventoryItem> Aurora.Framework.IEntityInventory.GetInventoryItems ( string  name  ) 

Get inventory items by name.

Parameters:
name 
Returns:
A list of inventory items with that name. If no inventory item has that name then an empty list is returned.

ISceneEntity Aurora.Framework.IEntityInventory.GetRezReadySceneObject ( TaskInventoryItem  item  ) 

Get the scene object referenced by an inventory item.

This is returned in a 'rez ready' state. That is, name, description, permissions and other details have been adjusted to reflect the part and item from which it originates.

Parameters:
item 
Returns:
The scene object. Null if the scene object asset couldn't be found

Implemented in OpenSim.Region.Framework.Scenes.SceneObjectPartInventory.

int Aurora.Framework.IEntityInventory.RemoveInventoryItem ( UUID  itemID  ) 

Remove an item from this entity's inventory.

Parameters:
itemID 
Returns:
Numeric asset type of the item removed. Returns -1 if the item did not exist in this prim's inventory.

Implemented in OpenSim.Region.Framework.Scenes.SceneObjectPartInventory.

void Aurora.Framework.IEntityInventory.RemoveScriptInstance ( UUID  itemId,
bool  sceneObjectBeingDeleted 
)

Stop a script which is in this prim's inventory.

Parameters:
itemId 
sceneObjectBeingDeleted Should be true if these scripts are being removed because the scene object is being deleted. This will prevent spurious updates to the client.

Implemented in OpenSim.Region.Framework.Scenes.SceneObjectPartInventory.

void Aurora.Framework.IEntityInventory.RemoveScriptInstances ( bool  sceneObjectBeingDeleted  ) 

Stop all the scripts in this entity.

Parameters:
sceneObjectBeingDeleted Should be true if these scripts are being removed because the scene object is being deleted. This will prevent spurious updates to the client.

void Aurora.Framework.IEntityInventory.ResetObjectID (  ) 

Reset parent object UUID for all the items in the prim's inventory.

If this method is called and there are inventory items, then we regard the inventory as having changed.

Parameters:
linkNum Link number for the part

Implemented in OpenSim.Region.Framework.Scenes.SceneObjectPartInventory.

void Aurora.Framework.IEntityInventory.RestoreInventoryItems ( ICollection< TaskInventoryItem >  items  ) 

Restore a whole collection of items to the entity's inventory at once. We assume that the items already have all their fields correctly filled out. The items are not flagged for persistence to the database, since they are being restored from persistence rather than being newly added.

Parameters:
items 

Implemented in OpenSim.Region.Framework.Scenes.SceneObjectPartInventory.

Save all script state saves for this object.

Implemented in OpenSim.Region.Framework.Scenes.SceneObjectPartInventory.

bool Aurora.Framework.IEntityInventory.UpdateInventoryItem ( TaskInventoryItem  item  ) 

Update an existing inventory item.

Parameters:
item The updated item. An item with the same id must already exist in this prim's inventory.
Returns:
false if the item did not exist, true if the update occurred successfully
